title: Cunningham, Michael
text:
Michael Kent Cunningham, age 66, of Topeka, Indiana passed away on Thursday, December 21, 2023 at Parkview Regional Medical Center in Fort Wayne. He was born on February 16, 1957, the son of Ruthann ( Ream) and Kyle Cunningham in LaGrange, Indiana. On August 6, 1983, he married Laure Roy in Ligonier, Indiana. He is survived by his wife of forty years, Laure Cunningham of Topeka; three children, Justin (Amanda) Cunningham, Jarod (Liz Rust) Cunningham, Jenna (Quinn) Groff all of Topeka; an adorable granddaughter, Halley Groff; four siblings, Kim (Joan Clark) Cunningham of Carefree, Arizona, Dawn (David) Hunnicutt of Fort Wayne, Leah (Kevin) Brown of Albion, and Holly Cunningham of Avon, Indiana; along with several nieces and nephews. Mike graduated from West Noble High School in 1975. He worked for Ligonier Telephone Company for over twenty years and also operated a Pioneer Seed Agency for over 43 years. Mike was a dedicated member of Topeka Baptist Church for over 40 years. He loved to travel, especially by train, playing golf whenever he could, and having coffee with the guys uptown. Above all, Mike loved his family and loved spending time with them and holding his brand new granddaughter, Halley. A funeral service will be held in Mike's honor at 11am on Wednesday, December 27, 2023 at Topeka Baptist Church, 104 North St, Topeka, IN 46571. Pastors Bob Wilson and Lyn Stutzman will officiate. Burial will follow at Eden Cemetery in Topeka. Family and friends will be received from 2-8 pm on Tuesday, December 26, 2023 at Topeka Baptist Church and also from 10-11 am prior to the service on Wednesday. Memorial contributions may be given in Mike's memory to Topeka Baptist Church. Yeager Funeral Home is assisting the family with arrangements. Memories and condolences may be shared with the family online at www.yeagerfuneralhome.com.

Plant a tree: How does it work
When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.
An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.
After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.
Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.
Tree Planting Timeline
Orders placed in:
January - May
Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.
June - December
Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
